text: Imraan khawaja from Hounslow in West
London one of the most prolific British
propagandists for the so-called Islamic
state a 27 year old amateur bodybuilder
he travelled to Syria a year ago and
seen here in the green on the Left he
spent his time encouraging other young
British men to join the fighting he
called himself a Buddha gyum al
Britannia there was one picture which
was very disturbing of him holding a bag
that had allegedly 15 severed heads
inside it of Syrian Army soldiers so
that was a picture that caused a lot of
consternation he was a member of rayet
alta weed a propaganda group that
produces slick posters and videos but in
June the group suddenly announced his
death on their Instagram account a
bodega malboro Thani was killed in
battle a few nights ago they wrote it
was a lie Imran khawaja had in fact
decided to return to Britain but to
avoid the attention of the security
services he decided to fake his own
death first his cousin taki Abbate a
taxi driver from Watford drove all the
way across Europe to Bulgaria to pick
him up
but although Imran khawaja had staged
his own death he hadn't successfully
covered his tracks and as he stepped off
the ferry here in Dover he was met by
counterterrorism officers he is now
pleaded guilty to four offences
including attending a terrorist training
camp and possessing a weapon for the
purposes of terrorism but it was his
enthusiastic work as a PR man for
Islamic states that may have done the
greatest harm these are some of the most
graphic images we've seen coming out of
Syria extreme images of violence
executions carried out with automatic
weapons and they've used these images to
promote their warped brand of
Islam and they've they've done that over
a number of months and and they use it
to entice others to to join them in
Syria he and his group rare tata weed is
still pumping out its propaganda on
social media trying to add to the
estimated 600 Britons who've already
travelled to Syria and Iraq to fight
Daniel Sandford BBC news
